NAEB RADIO NETWORK
PROGRAM OFFERING PROGRAM OFFERING
Title: WOODROW WILSON’S FOREIGN POLICY
Type: Lecture
Time: 55:00
No.: 5 programs
Origin: WFIU
Audience: Adult
Serial Number: 57-28
Release Date: Issue 18 (May 5)
In commemoration of the Woodrow Wilson Centennial we present this series on Wilson’s
foreign policy as seen in today’s perspective. These lectures were sponsored by
Indiana University in cooperation with the Woodrow Wilson Foundation.
Program
Issue
Topic and Speaker
1
2
3
4
18 ’’The Role of Colonel House in
Wilson's Diplomacy” - Charles Seymour,
President-Emeritus, Yale University.
19 ’’Woodrow Wilson and Collective
Security” - Edward H. Buehrig,
Professor of Government, Indiana
University.
20 ”Woodrow Wilson’s Latin-American
Policy” - Samuel Flagg Bemis,
Professor of History, Yale University.
21 ”A British View of Wilson’s Foreign
Policy” - Sir Llewellyn Woodward,
Institute for Advanced Study.
